clinical_study.brief_title: Early Postoperative Blood Glucose Variability and Outcome After TAVI
clinical_study.official_title: Early Postoperative Blood Glucose Variability and Outcome After TAVI : a Retrospective Single-centre Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Stress hyperglycaemia is a well-known risk factor of postoperative morbidity and mortality in cardiac surgery. Recently, several authors have reported that increased blood glucose (BG) variability could worsen the prognosis in this population.The transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI) is a low invasive procedure proposed as an alternative technique to aortic valve replacement surgery in high-risk patients.
The aim of this study is to describe the incidence of stress hyperglycaemia and assess whether BG variability could impact the outcome of patients undergoing TAVI.

primary_outcome.description: Stress hyperglycemia is defined as a blood glucose value above 7.7 mmol/l requiring insulin infusion within the 48 first hours following the TAVI.

secondary_outcome.description: Mean blood glucose value is the mean of all the blood glucose values measured during the 48 first hours following the TAVI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Standard deviation of blood glucose value
secondary_outcome.description: Standard deviation of glucose value is the standard deviation of all the blood glucose values measured during the 48 first hours following the TAVI.
Moderate hypoglycemia is defined as a blood glucose value under 3.3 mmol/l.
Severe hypoglycemia is defined as a blood glucose value under 2.2 mmol/l.
Severe hyperglycemia is defined as a blood glucose value above 11.0 mmol/l.

secondary_outcome.measure: Coefficient of variability of blood glucose
secondary_outcome.description: The coefficient of variability is the ratio of the standard deviation on the mean blood glucose value, expressed as a percentage.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean daily variation of blood glucose
secondary_outcome.description: The mean daily variation of blood glucose is defined as the mean of the daily differences between the maximal and the minimal glucose value.

arm_group.description: patients who died or suffered from stroke, acute coronary syndrome, heart failure, complete atrioventricular block or life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias within 30 days after the procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age>18 years old
- severe degenerative symptomatic aortic stenosis
- logistic Euroscore ≥ 20% or/and Society of Thoracic Surgeons score (STS) ≥ 10%
- recused for a conventional valve replacement by multidisciplinary team (surgeon, cardiologist) because of surgical contraindication or comorbidities related to the patient.
- written consent before the procedure concerning anonymous data processing.
Exclusion Criteria:
- death per procedure
- postoperative admission in a critical care unit
